title: Create service designs from aggregated images
content:
Once you configure image aggregations, you can use the search or filter options to begin.
You can search for images based on the following filters:

  • Integration type: AWS, Azure, vCenter, GCP
  • Category: Machine images or application stacks
  • Image category: Private or marketplace images

You can browse a unified listing of catalog items from popular cloud providers such as Amazon EC2, Microsoft Azure, VMware vCenter, and GCP. Once you find an image or application stack that meets your needs, you can create a service design from it.

Supported capsule versions

When creating service designs using aggregated images, the supported version of the capsule must be already installed on the suite. Use the table below to decide the required capsule version for each cloud service provider.

Cloud service provider Required capsule version Capsule download link on ITOM MPP
AWS 3.3.0 https://marketplace.opentext.com/itom/content/amazon-aws-capsule-cloudslang
Azure 3.3.1, 3.4.0, or 3.4.1 https://marketplace.opentext.com/itom/content/microsoft-azure-capsule-cloudslang
GCP 3.0.0 or 3.1.0 https://marketplace.opentext.com/itom/content/google-gcp-capsule-cloudslang
vCenter 3.1.0 https://marketplace.opentext.com/itom/content/vmware-vcenter-capsule-cloudslang

Create a service design

Prerequisite: Ensure that you have configured the Deployment Resource Providers. This enables the fulfillment of subscriptions. For information, see Deployment Resource Providers.

  1. From the main menu, go to Build->Design->Service Designer->Image Aggregation
  2. On the 'Image Aggregation' page, click the required image from the aggregated images.
  3. Under Design Configuration, specify the following details:
    • The design name. Change the default design name if required.
    • The zone(s) that you want to support in the design
    • The instance size(s) you want to support in the design
  4. Click Pricing Details to see the pricing details of the image based on the selected region(s) and instance size.
  5. Click Import.
  6. On the Import dialog, select the type of import.
    • Create and Publish: To create and publish a new service design
    • Create: To create a service design without publishing it. After creating the design, you can customize it before publishing.
  7. Click Import.
